definition: Bacchus (the Greek god of wine), aka Dionysus

sentences.english: Wine god do best forever, forever young.
sentences.chinese: 酒神永远尽如意，永远青春不老。

sentences.english: This tradition is also believed to come from the Thracians who may have danced similarly during Dionysian rituals.
sentences.chinese: 这项传统据信是出自色雷斯人酒神节中类似的舞蹈。

sentences.english: Moreover, in the church at the top of the painting of the god Bacchus.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在教堂的顶部，画上了酒神巴克斯。

sentences.english: Not charioted by Bacchus and his pards.
sentences.chinese: 不用酒神坐文豹的车驾。

sentences.english: The child would grow up to be Bacchus, the great god of wine.
sentences.chinese: 这个婴儿就是大名鼎鼎的酒神巴克斯。

sentences.english: Dionysian Spirit is a major concept of Nietzsche's philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 酒神精神是尼采的一个重要概念。

sentences.english: “Golden mountain” against the background of Garden of Bacchus.
sentences.chinese: “金色山”的背景是酒神巴克斯花园。

sentences.english: Bacchus has drowned more men than Nepture.
sentences.chinese: 酒神淹死的人比海神多。

sentences.english: And what about what was born out  of the Dionysian—the tragedy?
sentences.chinese: 悲剧是从酒神中诞生的吗？

sentences.english: In the most widely circulated legend of the "Bacchus wine making, " said.
sentences.chinese: 在这些传说中流传最为广泛的是“酒神造酒”说。

sentences.english: This is the day to worship the god of wine;
sentences.chinese: 今天是请酒神的日子，没有人怠慢。

sentences.english: He respectively uses phoebus and dionysus to symbolize the spirit of the two arts.
sentences.chinese: 他用日神和酒神来象征这两种艺术精神。

sentences.english: Dionysus is eternally the fundamental archetype in western art.
sentences.chinese: 酒神，一向是西方艺术的最根本的永恒原型。

sentences.english: What about that tremendous phenomenon of the Dionysian?
The thyrsus , tipped with fragrant cones of pine.
sentences.chinese: 酒神杖，顶端是芳香的松果。

sentences.english: This alcohol-poem complex came from the " non-Dionysiac spirit "of traditional Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 这种诗酒传统源于中国文化中的非酒神型特征。

definition: Dionysus, the god of wine in Greek mythology
Dante Alighieri (1265-1321), Italian poet, author of the Divine Comedy 神曲
Virgil or Vergilius (70-19 BC), Roman poet and author of the Aeneid 埃涅阿斯紀|埃涅阿斯纪[Ai1 nie4 a1 si1 Ji4]
Hermes, in Greek mythology, messenger of the Gods
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
